questions.question: What length of time do you have before you must notify the FAA in writing of your new address?
How much fuel do you need to bring on a flight?

choices.answer: Enough for the whole flight plus reserves
Enough for the duration of the first leg

questions.question: In an inflight emergency, a pilot may

choices.answer: Not deviate from the FAR's without permission
Deviate & provide a written report within 7 days

questions.question: Under what condition may a pilot allow a person that is obviously under the influence aboard?

choices.answer: If a second pilot is aboard
Only if the person is a patient under proper care/ emergency

The term "angle of attack" is defined as the angle

choices.answer: between the wing chord and relative wind
airplane's climb angle and the horizon
formed by the longitudinal axis and the chord line

questions.question: What is the effect of advancing the throttle in flight

choices.answer: both aircraft groundspeed and AOA will increase
Airspeed will remain constant but aircraft will climb
the aircraft will accelerate, which will cause turn  right

questions.question: What is the purpose of the rudder on an airplane
When are the four forces that act on a plane in equilibrium

choices.answer: When the aircraft is at rest on the groung

questions.question: What determines the longitudinal stability of an airplane

choices.answer: the effectiveness of the horiz. stab, rudder, and trim tab
the location of the CG with respect to the center of lift
the relationship of the thrust/lift to weight/drag

questions.question: FIGURE 2 - If an airplane weighs 2,300 lbs, what is the approximate weight in a 60 degree bank
What force makes an airplane turn
In what flight condition must an aircraft be placed in order to spin

choices.answer: Partially stalled with one wing low

questions.question: One of the main functions of flaps during approach and landing is to

choices.answer: decrease the angle of descent without increasing airspeed
permit a touchdown at a higher indicated airspeed
increase the angle of descent without increase to airspeed

questions.question: Ground effect is most likely to result in which problem

choices.answer: Settling to the surface abruptly during landing
Becoming airborne before reaching recommended t/o speed
Inability to get airborne even though airspeed is sufficient

questions.question: How does the wake turbulence vortex circulate around each wing

choices.answer: Inward, upward, and around each tip
outward, upward, and around each tip

questions.question: The wind condition that requires maximum caution when avoiding wake turbulence on landing is a
Should it become necessary to handprop an engine, it is important that a competent pilot

choices.answer: be at the controls in the cockpit
be in the cockpit and call out all commands

questions.question: One purpose of the dual ignition system on a plane is to provide for
Cruising at 9,500MSL, fuel/air mixture is correct - what occurs if a descent to 4500 is made

choices.answer: The mixture may become excessively lean
will be more fuel in the cylinders, excess will be absorbed
excessively rich, creating high cyl. head temp & detonation

questions.question: Which condition is most favorable to the development of carb ice

choices.answer: temps below freezing & a relative humidity less than 50%
temps between 32 & 50 F, and low humidity
temps between 20 & 70 F and high humidity

questions.question: What change occurs in the fuel/air mixture when carb heat is applied

choices.answer: A decrease in RPM results from the leaner mixture

choices.answer: 45 degree to the base leg just below traffic pattern alt
45 at the midpoint of the downwind leg at pattern altitude
cross over the aprt at pattern alt. to join the downwind leg

choices.answer: there are obstructions on the airport
wx at the apt located in class D airspace is below basic min
the Air Traffic Control tower is not in operation

questions.question: A lighted heliport can be identified by a

choices.answer: green, yellow, and white rotating beacon

questions.question: How should the flight controls be positioned while taxiing an a/c with left quartering tailwind
The presence of ice pellets at the surface is evidence that there

choices.answer: is a temperature inversion with freezing rain at higher alt

questions.question: Why is frost considered hazardous to flight

choices.answer: frost changes basic shape of the airfoils, decreasing lift
slows airflow over airfoil/increasing control effectivenessl
spoils smooth airflow over wing, decrease lift capabilities
